aboutMe.contentIntro: Hi, I'm Nolan! I'm a software developer living in Hokkaido, Japan. I moved from my home of Utah, USA, to Japan 3 years ago via the JET Program to teach English, and have spent the last 12 months learning Web Development. I spent most of my learning completing the Odin Project, an open source full-stack development curriculum for Ruby on Rails and React. Since finishing the bootcamp, I've began building my own applications while searching for a full-time position.
aboutMe.contentSkills1: My technical skills include JavaScript, Ruby, Ruby on Rails, React, TypeScript, Vite (how I built this website), HTML, and CSS. I'm particularly interested in creating websites and experiences users of all abilities can navigate effortlessly.
aboutMe.contentSkills2: I am also fluent in Japanese and JLPT N2 Certification (January, 2023). I can listen, speak, and read confidently, and am aiming towards N1 Certification.
aboutMe.contentHobbies: When I'm not coding, you can find me playing golf or basketball, reading about Ancient Rome, or spending time with my wonderful wife.

contactCard.content1: Feel free to reach out for collaborations or questions!

careerCard.content: Currently looking for a Software Development role anywhere in Japan or in the USA, and am available to relocate immediately.

card1.title: Borzonibook
card1.description: Create and customize your profile, follow your favorite users, and leave likes and comments on others' posts. Built entirely on Ruby on Rails, and launched through Heroku, this project pushed me to understand database relationships on a deeper level as I navigated connecting users, likes, posts, follows, and more.
card1.techStack: Tech Stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Hotwire, Stimulus, Tailwind CSS, Heroku

card2.title: Pokeshopper
card2.description: Filter through Pokemon by type, add them to a cart, fill out your order form, and checkout. Pokeshopper uses PokeAPI to grab random Pokemon's data and Rails converts them into products. Along with working with an API, Hotwire and Stimulus were key for dynamically updating the UI.
card2.techStack: Tech Stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Hotwire, Stimulus, Tailwind CSS

card3.title: My Portfolio
card3.description: This is my portfolio, made with Neobrutalism design. Refactored the the internationalization with i18next.
card3.techStack: Tech Stack: JavaScript, React, TypeScript, Vite, Heroku

card4.title: Avramax
card4.description: Avramax, my current project, is an online dueling application for Yugioh, my favorite card game. It features a Ruby on Rails API back-end to filter and query through a 13,000 card database quickly, and will use a React front-end to handle all of the interactions.
card4.techStack: Tech Stack: Ruby on Rails, React, PostgreSQL
